intro: Eugenia prosoneura, commonly known as the broad-leaved eucalypt, is a species of flowering plant in the myrtle family, Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy pink or white flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain aromatic, ellipsoid seeds. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Eugenia prosoneura is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
